password_strength.definition: Password strength is a measure of how effective a password is against guessing or brute-force attacks. A strong password is long, complex, and unpredictable.
password_strength.why_important: Weak passwords are a primary target for attackers and one of the most common reasons for account takeovers. A strong password is your first line of defense.
common_weaknesses: Including personal information like birthdays or names.
Lacking a mix of uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols.
Reusing the same password across multiple websites.
best_practices: Use a password manager to generate and store unique, complex passwords for every account.
Aim for a length of 16 characters or more.
Enable two-factor authentication (2FA) wherever possible as an extra layer of security.
